Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Benjamin T. Andrey was found guilty of OWI (4th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Benjamin T. Andrey in court, in custody, with attorney Gary R. Schmaus.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders warrant quashed.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed and read-in. Ct. 3 dismissed by operation of law.


Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
-  Sentence withheld for two years Probation - 3 days credit if revoked. 
-  5 years Drivers License Revocation. 
-  5 years Ignition Interlock on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant
- Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel meeting on November 19, 2014 or 30 days jail consecutive with Huber                                                          
- Alcohol Assessment
- Fine totaling: $2277.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation - APPLY BAIL. 
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to Waukesha County Sheriff's Department - append to fine
- Conditions of Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol/drugs. No use/possession of drugs without a valid prescription. Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent,  including psychiatric counseling. Maintain full-time employment and/or school. DNA Sample if not yet provided.
- 200 days jail Condition Time (nonworking hours) commencing FORTHWITH.    Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence forthwith.
